articles.headline: 4 Big Banks Score Perfect 61-Day Run
articles.snippet: Four giants of American finance each managed what is normally a rare feat: a perfect trading quarter.
articles.abstract: Four giants of American finance each managed what is normally a rare feat: a perfect trading quarter.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is the Wall Street equivalent of a perfect game of baseball — 27 up, 27 down, the final score measured in millions of dollars a day.

articles.headline: For Chernin, an Empire of His Own
articles.snippet: Peter A. Chernin, the subject of much speculation since his departure from the News Corporation, appears to be building his own ambitious media enterprise.
articles.abstract: Peter A. Chernin, the subject of much speculation since his departure from the News Corporation, appears to be building his own ambitious media enterprise.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Ever since Peter A. Chernin left the News Corporation as Rupert Murdoch’s second in command, the media world has wondered what he would do next.

articles.headline: I.M.F. Plays Deal Maker in Europe
articles.snippet: The International Monetary Fund recently persuaded the European Union to put up more cash and give Greece time to push through spending cuts.
articles.abstract: The International Monetary Fund recently persuaded the European Union to put up more cash and give Greece time to push through spending cuts.
articles.lead_paragraph: ZURICH — The International Monetary Fund is ready to do deals.

articles.headline: Revamped Microsoft Office Will Be Free on the Web
articles.snippet: As it tries to fend off rivals like Google, Microsoft will provide a free online version of its new Office software.
articles.abstract: As it tries to fend off rivals like Google, Microsoft will provide a free online version of its new Office software.
articles.lead_paragraph: Microsoft has created a chimera in its new Office 2010 software, part desktop software and part Web app.

articles.headline: Regulators Dissect Trades, Searching for Cause of Plunge
articles.snippet: Regulators reviewing the stock market free fall last Thursday are examining heavy selling in the market for stock-index futures by a single trader, beginning 10 minutes before stocks began to plummet.
articles.abstract: Regulators reviewing the stock market free fall last Thursday are examining heavy selling in the market for stock-index futures by a single trader, beginning 10 minutes before stocks began to plummet.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Regulators examining the causes of the brief stock market free fall last Thursday are looking closely at heavy selling in the market for stock-index futures by a single trader, beginning 10 minutes before stock prices began to plummet.
articles.byline: By Edward Wyatt and Graham Bowley

articles.headline: Specter, After Shift, Faces Fire From Both Sides
articles.snippet: A year after leaving the Republican Party, Senator Arlen Specter is fighting rejection at the hands of Democrats.
articles.abstract: A year after leaving the Republican Party, Senator Arlen Specter is fighting rejection at the hands of Democrats.
articles.lead_paragraph: ALLENTOWN, Pa. — One year after leaving the Republican Party in the face of crumbling support, Senator Arlen Specter of Pennsylvania is now fighting to avert rejection — and presumably the end of his career — at the hands of Democrats.

articles.headline: In Greek Debt Crisis, Some See Parallels to U.S.
articles.snippet: The U.S. and Greece have governments bigger than they are paying for, and it cannot be blamed all on politicians.
articles.abstract: The U.S. and Greece have governments bigger than they are paying for, and it cannot be blamed all on politicians.
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s easy to look at the protesters and the politicians in Greece — and at the other European countries with huge debts — and wonder why they don’t get it. They have been enjoying more generous government benefits than they can afford. No mass rally and no bailout fund will change that. Only benefit cuts or tax increases can.

articles.headline: A Proposal to End Shady Car Dealers
articles.snippet: Consumer advocates say car dealers should be included in the new legislation for financial reforms.
articles.abstract: Consumer advocates say car dealers should be included in the new legislation for financial reforms.
articles.lead_paragraph: The tussling in Washington over financial regulation has focused on the merits and dangers of derivatives, establishing a procedure for the orderly liquidation of failed banks and setting up a new consumer protection agency.

articles.headline: Fifth Deadly Attack on a School Haunts China
articles.snippet: Seven children and two adults were hacked to death at a kindergarten in the latest attack in a Chinese school.
articles.abstract: Seven children and two adults were hacked to death at a kindergarten in the latest attack in a Chinese school.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Gates and cameras have been installed at schools. Security guards have been trained to fend off knife-wielding attackers. China’s top security official convened a nationwide conference call, ordering underlings to protect children when they attend classes.

articles.headline: Deficit Cuts Promised in Britain
articles.snippet: In his first pledge at the helm of the treasury, George Osborne said he planned to significantly accelerate efforts to reduce spending in Britain.
articles.abstract: In his first pledge at the helm of the treasury, George Osborne said he planned to significantly accelerate efforts to reduce spending in Britain.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The task of bringing Britain’s record budget deficit under control is now in the hands of the country’s youngest chancellor of the Exchequer in more than a century.
articles.byline: By Julia Werdigier and Landon Thomas Jr
